medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset of pain in the chest and upper back.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced pressure pain that began one week after discharge from a cesarean section, described as maximal at onset, initially located in the throat, then radiating to the chest and back. The pain was persistent and accompanied by mild dyspnea, wheezing, sweating, chilliness, and nausea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypothyroidism, asthma, gestational diabetes mellitus, seven first-trimester miscarriages, and a prior cholecystectomy 11 years ago.
medical_history.family_history: The father had hypertension and multiple strokes, dying at age 45; the mother is well.
medical_history.social_history: Resides with husband, infant daughter, and two other daughters; a son lives with his biological father.
